cip.render.raytrace.camera

Class ACamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.raytrace.camera.ACamera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDynXmlObject, INamedObject, IRtCamera
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Aperture, PinHole

    public abstract class ACamera
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDynXmlObject, INamedObject, IRtCamera
    This is an abstract class for a ray tracing camera. It offers an implementation of the most common elements of a ray tracing camera and some functions to help in camera parsing.
    Since:
    1.0

      • initSampling

        public void initSampling(int nSample,
                         float[] f1dSample,
                         float[] f1dRandom,
                         Point2f[] pt2dSample,
                         Point2f[] pt2dRandom,
                         Point3f[] pt3dSample,
                         Point3f[] pt3dRandom)
        Description copied from interface: IRtCamera
        Specifies the sampling arrays that should be used for distributed ray-tracing. Cameras that do not participate in distributed ray-tracing will normally ignore this function, or, pass the arrays down to child cameras which may make use of the sampling arrays. Normally, these are used for depth of field in cameras with a non-point aperture.
        Specified by:
        initSampling in interface IRtCamera
        Parameters:
        nSample - The number of sub-samples (over-samples) per pixel.
        f1dSample - The 1d sample displacement array. The length of this array will be equal to the number of sub-samples per pixel. This array is for oversampling linear phenomena.
        f1dRandom - The 1d 'jitter' array. No assumptions should be made about the length of this array.
        pt2dSample - The 2d sample displacement array. The length of this array will be equal to the number of sub-samples per pixel. This array is for oversampling area phenomena.
        pt2dRandom - The 2d 'jitter' array. No assumptions should be made about the length of this array.
        pt3dSample - The 3d sample displacement array. The length of this array will be equal to the number of sub-samples per pixel. This array is for oversampling volume phenomena.
        pt3dRandom - The 3d 'jitter' array. No assumptions should be made about the length of this array.

      • initPicturePlane

        public void initPicturePlane(int nXres,
                             int nYres,
                             float fPixelAspect)
        Description copied from interface: IRtCamera
        Specify the picture plane that will be used in mapping pixels to rays.
        Specified by:
        initPicturePlane in interface IRtCamera
        Parameters:
        nXres - The X resolution (width) of the picture plane.
        nYres - The Y resolution (height) of the picture plane.
        fPixelAspect - The aspect ratio of a pixel, width/height.

      • getRay

        public void getRay(Line3f ray,
                   RayIntersection rayIntersection,
                   int nXpixel,
                   int nYpixel,
                   int nSample,
                   int nRandom)
        Description copied from interface: IRtCamera
        Performs the mapping from a pixel and pixel sub-sample to a ray. The upper left corner of the picture plane is taken as 0,0. If the rayIntersection is non-null, then the view vector and sampling information (sample start offset and sample solid angle) will be set in the ray intersection
        Specified by:
        getRay in interface IRtCamera
        Parameters:
        ray - The ray that will be computed as the mapping from the specified pixel and subsample.
        rayIntersection - The ray intersection to be initialized (if non-null).
        nXpixel - The pixel X location.
        nYpixel - The pixel Y location.
        nSample - The pixel sub-sample.
        nRandom - The random value for this sub-sample..
